AI Code Review Iteration2 Reliability: Null Check SeverityHigh The `mappedCollection` variable could be null if `FirstOrDefault` returns null from both collections. Accessing `mappedCollection.AutoscaleMaxThroughput` on line 102 would result in a NullReferenceException. It might be better to add a null check before attempting to set the property. Here is the suggested code: ``` CosmosDb.BaseCosmosDbCollection mappedCollection = baseConfigurationSettings.Settings.ResourceSettings.CosmosDb.Regional.CollectionsWithTtl .FirstOrDefault(c => c.CollectionName == collection.Key); mappedCollection ??= baseConfigurationSettings.Settings.ResourceSettings.CosmosDb.Regional.CollectionsWithoutTtl .FirstOrDefault(c => c.CollectionName == collection.Key); if (mappedCollection != null) { mappedCollection.AutoscaleMaxThroughput = autoScaleMaxThroughPutInt; } ``` This comment refers to line 97 to 102 in the new file.

comments.content:
AI Code Review Iteration2 Reliability: Null Check SeverityHigh The `mappedAlert` variable could be null if `FirstOrDefault` returns null. Additionally, `mappedAlert.Metrics.FirstOrDefault(...)` could also return null. Accessing the `Threshold` property on line 107 would result in a NullReferenceException if either is null. It might be better to add null checks before attempting to set the property. Here is the suggested code: ``` // Update the alert threshold in the mapped alert CosmosDb.CosmosDbAlert mappedAlert = baseConfigurationSettings.Settings.ResourceSettings.CosmosDb.Regional.Alerts.FirstOrDefault(a => a.Name.Contains(collection.Key)); if (mappedAlert != null) { CosmosDb.Metric mappedMetric = mappedAlert.Metrics.FirstOrDefault(m => m.MetricName == "ProvisionedThroughput"); if (mappedMetric != null) { mappedMetric.Threshold = (int)(autoScaleMaxThroughPutInt * 0.75); } } ``` This comment refers to line 104 to 107 in the new file.

AI Code Review Iteration2 Reliability: Null Check SeverityHigh Similar to lines 98-107, the `mappedCollection` (lines 193-198) and `mappedAlert` (line 201) variables could be null, and `mappedAlert.Metrics.FirstOrDefault(...)` could also return null. Accessing properties on line 198 and 203 would result in a NullReferenceException. It might be better to add null checks before attempting to set these properties. Here is the suggested code: ``` CosmosDb.BaseCosmosDbCollection mappedCollection = cosmosDbSettings.Regional.CollectionsWithTtl .FirstOrDefault(c => c.CollectionName == collection.Key); mappedCollection ??= cosmosDbSettings.Regional.CollectionsWithoutTtl .FirstOrDefault(c => c.CollectionName == collection.Key); if (mappedCollection != null) { mappedCollection.AutoscaleMaxThroughput = autoScaleMaxThroughPutInt; } // Update the alert threshold in the mapped alert CosmosDb.CosmosDbAlert mappedAlert = cosmosDbSettings.Regional.Alerts.FirstOrDefault(a => a.Name.Contains(collection.Key)); if (mappedAlert != null) { var metric = mappedAlert.Metrics.FirstOrDefault(m => m.MetricName == "ProvisionedThroughput"); if (metric != null) { metric.Threshold = (int)(autoScaleMaxThroughPutInt * 0.75); } } ``` This comment refers to line 193 to 203 in the new file.

If we need deep copies like this, I'd recommend serializing the original into JSON, then deserializing into the new object. Like:
`JsonConvert.DeserializeObject<CosmosDbCollectionWithTtl>(JsonConvert.SerializeObject(c))`

This way it's much smaller and we don't have to keep updating multiple files whenever the schema changes

I asked AI to deep copy these json objects for me and that was the result :/
but yeah this is way more concise and human-readable

Is there maybe a different way to do this? Could we potentially have some flag/enum in the base config settings that tells the generator that the threshold should be computed?
Just trying to see if there's a way to avoid hardcoding metric names like this, in case we want to do it for other metrics in the future

I made it a constant. Currently I don't seem to find a good way to automate calculations as the name&location of the metric are very specific.
Let me know if you have any ideas to make it easier for future metrics.

Do we still need this separate "collections" property? This means we're duplicating collection names.
Could we embed the properties from CollectionSettings into the BaseCosmosDbCollection class?
This is currently shared by GlobalCommon as well, and I actually prefer retaining it as it's easier to define throughput values by region with this dictionary approach

I think this is ok, as I want to align the naming with COLLECTIONSWITH(OUT)TTLS
